src:
สำนักงานสลากฯ แจ้งเปิดให้บริการวันที่ 4-5 พ.ย.นี้ตามปกติ

02 Nov 2019, 07:18


สำนักงานสลากฯ แจ้งเปิดให้บริการ ในวันที่ 4-5 พ.ย.นี้ เป็นปกติ ผู้ถูกลอตเตอรี่มาขึ้นรางวัลได้วันจันทร์นี้เลย พร้อมเปิดจำหน่าย ซื้อจองสลากฯ ตามกำหนดเดิม

พ.ต.อ.บุญส่ง จันทรีศรี ผู้อำนวยการสำนักงานสลากกินแบ่งรัฐบาล กล่าวว่า สํานักงานสลากฯ ยังเปิดให้บริการในวันที่ 4-5พ.ย.62 ตามปกติ ดังนั้นผู้ถูกรางวัลสามารถเดินทางมาขึ้นรางวัลได้ตั้งแต่วันที่ 4 พ.ย.เป็นต้นไป รวมถึงการเปิดจำหน่ายสลากฯ ทั้งในส่วนของสลากโควตา งวดประจําวันที่ 16 พ.ย. 62 ให้กับสมาคม มูลนิธิ องค์กร จํานวน 901 ราย การทํารายการสลากสั่งซื้อ งวดวันที่ 16 พ.ย. 62 การทํารายการสลากจองล่วงหน้า งวดประจําวันที่ 1 ธ.ค.62 ก็ยังทำตามกำหนดเดิม ตลอดจนการจัดคละสลากซื้อ งวดประจําวันที่ 16 พ.ย.62 ก็จะดําเนินการส่งให้กับ บริษัท ไปรษณีย์ไทย จํากัด เพื่อแจกจ่ายให้กับผู้ซื้อสลากต่อไป“ด้วยเหตุผลและความจําเป็นดังกล่าว เพื่อไม่ให้เกิดความเสียหายแก่สํานักงานฯหรือกระทบต่อ การให้บริการประชาชน สำนักงานสลากฯจึงอาศัยอํานาจตามความในมาตรา17 แห่งพระราชบัญญัติสํานักงานสลากกินแบ่ง รัฐบาล พ.ศ.2517 และที่แก้ไขเพิ่มเติม ประกอบกับมติคณะรัฐมนตรี เมื่อวันที่ 15 ต.ค.62 สํานักงาน สลากกินแบ่งรัฐบาล จึงกําหนดให้วันจันทร์ที่ 4 และวันอังคารที่ 5 พ.ย.62 เป็นวันทําการปกติ”

The four Chinese communiques release signals: the three major actions of the CCP against Hong Kong

02 Nov 2019, 07:11

[New Tang Dynasty, Beijing time, November 02, 2019] In the communiqué of the Fourth Plenary Session of the Chinese Communist Party, the Hong Kong anti-delivery movement, which is concerned about public opinion, responded strongly and hoped to draw some red lines for Hong Kong by legal means. Some scholars and experts and public opinion analysis believe that the CCP may have three major moves in Hong Kong.
After the four-day ruling of the 19th CPC Central Committee in the 19th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the party’s plenary communiqué issued by the party media not only did not respond to the demands of Hong Kong’s anti-send sports protesters, but also participated in the political participation of the Hong Kong democrats. A more stringent legal bottom line is given.
Although the communique claims to uphold and improve "one country, two systems", it also said that it must strictly govern Hong Kong and Macao in accordance with the Constitution and the Basic Law, and establish a sound legal system and enforcement mechanism for special administrative regions to safeguard national security.
Some experts have analyzed that this shows that the CCP has not changed its current attitude of ruling Hong Kong from the roots, that is, its core is not to implement "one country, two systems". The official document is the first time to express Hong Kong's problems in this way. The matter is not simple. It will certainly be implemented accordingly.
Although international public opinion believes that the excessive interference of the CCP in Hong Kong affairs is the main cause of the "reverse delivery" outbreak, the communique shows that the CCP feels that excessive dismissal on the Hong Kong issue has caused the situation in Hong Kong to deteriorate today.
The communique also shows that the CCP must continue to promote Hong Kong's implementation of "one country, two systems", but it must also clearly outline some of the bottom lines in order to reverse the current problems. The CCP's approach is to juxtapose the CCP Constitution and the Basic Law. That is to exhaust the powers conferred by the Basic Law.

The CCP may have three major moves in Hong Kong.

According to the analysis of Taiwan scholars and public opinion by the Central News Agency, according to the Basic Law, if Beijing draws a red line for Hong Kong people in the future, it may have three major actions in Hong Kong.
First, the Hong Kong Government is instructed to enact legislation on Article 23 of the Basic Law. Article 23 stipulates that Hong Kong should enact legislation to prohibit any treason, secession, incitement to insurgency, subversion of the CCP and theft of state secrets, and prohibit foreign political organizations or Groups conduct political activities in Hong Kong and prohibit contact with foreign political organizations or groups.
In 2003, the Hong Kong government introduced 23 pieces of legislation, which was strongly opposed by the general public. At the same time, 500,000 people were protested on the streets. The Hong Kong government was forced to withdraw the draft.
Second, in accordance with the provisions of Article 18 of the Basic Law, some laws and regulations of the Constitution of the Chinese Communist Party were enacted in Hong Kong. Article 18 stipulates that the Constitution of the Chinese Communist Party is not implemented in Hong Kong except for those listed in Annex III of the Basic Law. At the same time, it also stipulates that the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress decides to declare the state of war, or decides that Hong Kong will enter a state of emergency and issue an order to implement the Constitution of the Chinese Communist Party in Hong Kong.
Third, Chapter 8 of the Basic Law stipulates that the power of interpretation of the Basic Law belongs to the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of the Communist Party of China. Since the transfer of Hong Kong's sovereignty to Beijing, the Chinese Communist Party has repeatedly explained Hong Kong's controversial issues. The most recent interpretation of the oath of the Legislative Council members has led to the seizure of the qualifications of several members of the Pan-Pan.
Taiwan media analysis said that in the plenary communiqué, it not only emphasized the continued promotion of "one country, two systems", but also exhausted the powers given to Beijing by the Basic Law and governed the problems arising in Hong Kong from the legal level. It was also a tough response to "reverse delivery." It shows that the CCP has a clear idea about this, and it will not be vague in promoting the above work in the future.
Cheng Xiang, a senior media person in Hong Kong, once analyzed that the Hong Kong people were very worried that the Chinese Communist Party used the political and legal system of the mainland for Hong Kong. Therefore, when the Basic Law was enacted, it was intended to exclude the Constitution of the Chinese Communist Party. "."
The original intention of Articles 5, 11, 18 and Annex III of the Basic Law is precisely to effectively separate the two political and legal systems. That is to say, except that certain important provisions apply to Hong Kong (such as Article 31 of the Constitution of the Chinese Communist Party), the application of most of the provisions of the Constitution of the Chinese Communist Party in Hong Kong is basically excluded.
Moreover, the legal experts who participated in the drafting in the same year also indicated that these "constitutional exclusion regulations" did not violate the Constitution, that is, the original legislative intent of the Basic Law in that year was to make the Constitution irrelevant to the Basic Law. The object of the "Basic Law" is "Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of China".
When Deng Xiaoping met with Hong Kong and Macao people, he also said, "Do not ask everyone to love socialism and support the Communist Party. As long as you agree that Hong Kong will return to you, you are patriotic." The Fourth Plenary Session will juxtapose the Constitution and the Basic Law to jointly control Hong Kong. The establishment of "the legal system and enforcement mechanism for safeguarding national security" shows that the CCP has not made any substantial changes in the control of Hong Kong. The CCP will sooner or later "account after the fall."
(Reporter Li Yun Report / Editor: Li Quan)
